Sentencas: Electrochemical impedance spectroscopy (EIS) is a very useful method for the characterization of fuel cells.
Titulo: Electrochemical impedance spectra of solid-oxide fuel cells and polymer membrane fuel cells

Sentencas: The anode and cathode transfer functions have been determined independently without a reference electrode using symmetric gas supply of hydrogen or oxygen on both electrodes of the fuel cell at open circuit potential (OCP).
Titulo: Electrochemical impedance spectra of solid-oxide fuel cells and polymer membrane fuel cells

Sentencas: EIS are given for both polymer electrolyte fuel cells (PEFC) and solid oxide fuel cells (SOFC) at current densities up to 0.76 A cm(-2) (PEFC) and 0.22 A cm(-2) (SOFC).
Titulo: Electrochemical impedance spectra of solid-oxide fuel cells and polymer membrane fuel cells

Sentencas: With increasing current density the PEFC-impedance decreases significantly in the low frequency range reaching a minimum at 0.4 A cm(-2)
Titulo: Electrochemical impedance spectra of solid-oxide fuel cells and polymer membrane fuel cells

Sentencas: At even higher current densities an increasing contribution of water diffusion is observed: the cell impedance increases again.
Titulo: Electrochemical impedance spectra of solid-oxide fuel cells and polymer membrane fuel cells

Sentencas: From EIS of SOFC a finite diffusion behavior is observed even at OCP, depending on water partial pressure of the anodic gas supply.
Titulo: Electrochemical impedance spectra of solid-oxide fuel cells and polymer membrane fuel cells

Sentencas: This additional element reflects the influence of water partial pressure on the cell potential.
Titulo: Electrochemical impedance spectra of solid-oxide fuel cells and polymer membrane fuel cells

Sentencas: The simulation of the measured EIS with an equivalent circuit enables the calculation of the individual voltage losses in the fuel cell.
Titulo: Electrochemical impedance spectra of solid-oxide fuel cells and polymer membrane fuel cells
